definition: to bubble up/to rush forth
(used in place names)
variant of 湧|涌[yong3]
"water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
the Yongjiang river 甬江[Yong3 jiang1] through Ningbo 寧波|宁波[Ning2 bo1]/abbr. for Ningbo
variant of 桶[tong3], bucket/(classifier) cubic dry measure (5 pecks 五斗, approx half-liter)
path screened by walls on both sides
to emerge in large numbers/to spring up/to emerge prominently
to come pouring in/influx
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
to gush/to gush out/to pour out
to spill/to overflow (of water, crowds)/to crowd (into a space)
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
to surge like the tide
to well up/to boil out/to bubble forth/to spurt
to bubble out/to squirt
waves surging forth/roaring sea
gushing spring
to gush/to spurt
to roll over and over (of billows or clouds)

sentences.english: In early morning mist that rolls in from the coast, two brown bears tussle like teenagers.
sentences.chinese: 清晨，雾从海岸边涌来，两只棕熊像顽童般嬉闹。

sentences.english: The villagers rushed down the street. Lorian was lost in the midst of them.
sentences.chinese: 村民们沿着街道向前涌去，洛里安也消失在人群中。

sentences.english: Finally those who hunt them must be punished severely.
sentences.chinese: 最后，对涌锒猎珍稀野生动物的人必须严惩。

sentences.english: Curious sightseers rolled up in their hundreds.
sentences.chinese: 数以百计的好奇的观光客都涌到那儿。

sentences.english: Between the breakers and shore, a lot of water goes in and goes out with a lot of force.
sentences.chinese: 在岸边和碎浪之间，在强力的推动下，水涌来涌去。

sentences.english: As soon as the gates were opened, crowds of football supporters piled in.
sentences.chinese: 门一打开，成群的为足球赛呐喊助威的人涌了进来。

sentences.english: The football match (being) over， crowds of people poured out into the street.
sentences.chinese: 足球赛五结束，从群便涌到大街上。

sentences.english: E Mao as a fan, a Miaoji mind.
sentences.chinese: 鹅毛扇这么一扇，一个妙计涌上心头。

sentences.english: Eventually you’ll realize that happiness and love can come from anywhere.
sentences.chinese: 最后你会意识到，幸福和爱从四处涌来。

sentences.english: No president can satisfy this great welling up of external demands.
sentences.chinese: 没有总统能使这涌上前来的外部要求得到满足。

sentences.english: A cavity blood, nowhere to flow, an upsurge of emotion, such as surge.
sentences.chinese: 一腔热血，无处可流，心潮澎湃如波涌。

sentences.english: The moment the door was opened, people began to pack into the hall.
sentences.chinese: 门一开，人们就向大厅里涌了进去。

sentences.english: The film was over. The students poured out in crowds.
sentences.chinese: 电影散场后学生们一群一群往外涌。

sentences.english: All the old hatred for their former enemy flared up.
sentences.chinese: 对他们过去敌人的一切旧恨宿怨顿时涌上心头。

sentences.english: At five o'clock workers poured out of the factory.
sentences.chinese: 钟时，工人从工厂里涌了出来。

sentences.english: The train to Tung Chung is arriving.
sentences.chinese: 前往东涌嘅列车即将到达。

definition: to gush/to gush out/to pour out
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
to surge like the tide
tide
to spill/to overflow (of water, crowds)/to crowd (into a space)
to roll over and over (of billows or clouds)
to bubble out/to squirt
to swarm/to flock
to cascade down/to flow in torrents/(fig.) outpouring (of emotions)
to pour down in torrents
to flock (to see)/to mill/to throng
to well up/to boil out/to bubble forth/to spurt
(of a watercourse) to breach its dike/(of dikes) to collapse
to come pouring in/influx
to flow at great speed/to pour/racing current
lit. to topple the mountains and overturn the seas (idiom); earth-shattering/fig. gigantic/of spectacular significance
